meanings.definition: The condition in which a plant or animal is native and restricted to a certain geographic area.
meanings.sent1: The endemism of the species to this island makes it unique.
meanings.sent2: The endemism of the bird species in this forest is fascinating.
meanings.sent3: The endemism of the flowers in this garden is like having a secret treasure.
meanings.sent4: The endemism of the fish in this lake is a testament to its purity.
meanings.sent5: The endemism of the plants in this desert is a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The quality of being characteristic of a particular area or environment.
meanings.sent1: The endemism of the culture in this town is evident in its traditions.
meanings.sent2: The endemism of the architecture in this city reflects its history.
meanings.sent3: The endemism of the music in this club creates a unique atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The endemism of the language in this region adds to its charm.
meanings.sent5: The endemism of the cuisine in this restaurant showcases local flavors.

meanings.definition: The occurrence or presence of a species only in a specific region.
meanings.sent1: The endemism of the butterfly species in this park is a delight to see.
meanings.sent2: The endemism of the reptile species in this swamp is well-documented.
meanings.sent3: The endemism of the squirrel species in this forest is a topic of interest.
meanings.sent4: The endemism of the bird species in this reserve is a conservation priority.
meanings.sent5: The endemism of the plant species in this garden is a botanical wonder.
